page.title: 09Coulsdon Woods
page.content: Coulsdon Woods is an {ancient woodland,} covering about 8 acres between two areas of housing. Coulsdon Woods is a {habitat} for many creatures such as butterflies, badgers, foxes, collared doves, wood pigeons and nuthatches. There are also many varieties of {flowers}, such as dog rose, burnet rose and red campion. A lot of the woodland has been {coppiced}-one of the coppiced ash trees is 900 years old. There is one sessile oak tree which is a sign that the woods are ancient. Some {plans} have been put forward to build 18 houses on part of Coulsdon Woods, which the Coulsdon Woods Committee is trying to stop. At the moment, the Woods are used mostly by local youngsters as a {playing area} and by teenagers on motorbikes. Some local people are very concerned about this.
